## Vegan Meatballs  

| Servings | Time | Source |
|:---|:---|:-------------------|
| 4 servings  | 60-75 min | Minimalist Baker, [minimalistbaker.com/the-best-vegan-meatballs](https://minimalistbaker.com/the-best-vegan-meatballs/) | 



### Ingredients:

- 1 cup cooked & cooked quinoa
- 15 oz can black beans
- 2 TBSP oil
- 3 cloves garlic
- &frac12; cup shallot
- &frac14; salt 
- 2&frac12; fresh oregano or 1&frac14; dry oregano
- &frac12; tsp red pepper flake
- &frac12; tsp ground fennel/fennel seeds 
- &frac12; cup vegan parm: 6 TBSP cashews, 1.5 TBSP nutritional yeast, 3/8 tsp salt, 1/8 tsp garlic powder
- 2 TBSP tomato paste
- 3 TBSP fresh herbs (parsley or basil)


### Directions 

- MORNING: in a small pot add &frac13; cup quinoa and &frac23; cup water, bring to a boil then cover and simmer for 15 min.  Shut off stove and set aside. 
- Make vegan parmesan by blending all ingredients into a food processor
- Heat oven to 350 degrees, rinse black beans and put on a baking sheet with parchment paper, cook for 15 min
- heat small pan on stove over medium heat, add oil, then garlic and shallots, stir and cook for 2-3 min  
  Group 1 into food processor -- gently blend into a loose meal 
  * black beans
  * oil/garlic/shallot
  * salt/oregano/red pepper/fennel  
  Group 2 into food processor -- gently blend into a textured dough 
  * quinoa
  * vegan parm
  * tomato paste/fresh herbs
- Roll into 12 individual meatballs, then cool in the fridge for at least 15 min
- Heat oven to 375 degrees, bake meatballs for 20-30 min

Once cool, put in freezer for storage
